content.question: The graph of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is shown. The value of <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, the fraction with numerator f of x, minus 1, and denominator the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times x, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></math> is

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction 3 over pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the negative of the fraction 1 over pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>π</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction 3 over pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mfrac></math>

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
